text:
Technically speaking, adding support for wspiapi.h is a good idea, but I suggest to use it only if you really want to support older platforms.
A good addition would be:

#if APR_HAVE_WSPIAPI_H && _WIN32_WINNT <= 0x0500
#include <wspiapi.h>
#endif

Although IPv6 is supported on older platforms too (sometimes experimental), I'm suggesting this because required functions like freeaddrinfo() are resolved with some pointer to functions and some extra stuff, while you will have direct call to functions exported from ws2_32 on XP and later.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: We will no longer be supporting windows 2000, Extended Support terminated on 7/13/2010.  We never targeted our IPv6 support to that particular OS, as that KB article notes, Microsoft's support was something of a kludge.
